content: Hi Erin, thanks for your question! You know, as I read your question the answer that popped most in my head was “it depends”. I mean, it seems like you’re saying “since it’s not fair for either my roommate or I to live near work, we’ll both compromise and live further”. Which I guess is the honorable thing to do? So then the answer becomes “it depends”. It depends on whether or not both roommates are looking for jobs closer to where they live. It depends on how “lengthy” the lengthy commutes are (I spoke about riding bikes to work yesterday which would save a ton of money). It depends on how “nonexistent” the public transportation is (which I can totally understand since I had to use public transportation in LA to get to school when I first moved there and didn’t have a driver’s license… It was extremely annoying because the city is so spread out I’d have to take two buses and ride one cab. Every day. If I had a car back then I’d absolutely have used that option) It depends on whether or not you’re just making excuses (which, FYI I don’t think you are. Your concerns seem to be legit vs someone yesterday who commented “oh my commute is only 4 miles away so spending money on gas isn’t a big deal”… Sure… If you haven’t done the math) I’m sure you’ve considered all the options :) So there’s nothing I can say/ add. Best, R
